name: Heart of Clojure 2019
tzNote: Start and end times are given in the timezone of the event. Offset by -tzOffset for UTC.

events.name: Doors & light breakfast
Introduction
Yulia Startsev - To loosen up, to put together.
Fabrizio Ferrai - Live-coding a Compiler: A Challenge
Lisa Passing - Come with us to the world of the fragment shader
Chris Adams - What you can do when software is heating the world
Lily M. Goh - Engineering Empathy
Tiago Luchini - Building Resilient Clojure Apps
Mey Beisaron - Back to Future: How 80s Arcade Games Taught me Clojure
Ramón Huidobro - How teaching kids to code can make you a better developer
Sarah Groff Hennigh-Palermo - Raving Through the 90s with SVG and Clojurescript
Closing remarks
Doors & light breakfast
Daniel Compton - Money for Nothing: The past and future of funding OSS
Chelsey Mitchell - Does Clojure wear Prada?
Maarten Truyens - Innovation in an immutable industry: Clojure in law
Jivago Alves -  '(Growing Function-Oriented Software (With Parenthesis))
Tobias Pfeiffer - Functioning Among Humans
Lightning talks
Rachel Lawson - My opensource project; It’s all about the code. Oh, wait, no it’s not...
Thank you & goodbye
